text:
Getting an N64 with this game, back in 1996... It was like jumping into the future. But with no apprehension, just full confidence in Nintendo's genius.

We should be grateful for that golden era.

text: God, I love this game.

author: SkaTino Senseï

text: Actually my family won the N64 in a Taco Bell sweepstakes. we were so broke but we really wanted it. :D The deal was that whenever u buy medium sodas at TB you would get Nintendo themed cups. UNDER the cup you would get one of the faces of these four characters: DK, Yoshi, Luigi, and Mario. DK didn't get u anything, and it went up in rewards from taco and food to the rare mario getting you a N64 with this game. anyone remember that? i was 5 or 6 then :D
author: Edwin Murillo

text: I think the one level I spent the most time in was Jolly Roger Bay. I loved the theme for when Mario is on land. Never cared much for when he's in water or in the cave area (I hate the drums in that one...) but the land area music always had this sort of calming feel to it.
author: E Braunstein

text: I'm guessing the next 5 entries, in no particular order, are Ocarina of Time, Link's Awakening, Chrono Trigger, Mother 3 and EarthBound. There's no doubt Supra's had fond memories for Chrono Trigger, EarthBound, and Ocarina of Time, but I remember in a Mother 3 upload that he said that Link's Awakening and Mother 3 are his 2 favorite portable games ever.
author: Luis G. Ramirez

text: I've been waiting for this track to appear for soooo damn long.
author: TheTJWorks

text: My nostalgia. It's sticky.
author: RascalTC

text: Yep, this game was something special back then. Half of my time spent on this game was actually progressing in it, the other half was wandering around and doing my own thing. I used to put on the metal cap and pretend I was the T-1000 from Terminator 2.
author: GoRedskinsAndWizards

text: Ah, yes, summer of 95, 96, 98, 99 or whenever this came. That was a good summer.
author: tttc

text: I remember playing this on the o'll N64, I always loved getting lost in the castle and finding new secrets and adventures. I might go boot up the N64 and play it now actually!
author: LEEZY582

text: I remember playing the DS port when I was a kid, it was the second DS game I bought after Mario&Luigi: Partners in Time (which is probably my most nostalgic game of all time). Today, I'm trying to get every star for it, and I've got ~120 so far. So many good times with this game...
author: Jirt

text: It's no longer a favorite game of mine but it'll always be one of those games I remember for having that kind of impact on me back then. That anticipation, that experience. It doesn't come often.
author: Waywarde

text: This is actually my favorite videogame, mostly due to nostalgia as it was the first one I played. I didn't get hype for it because I didn't know of its existence.

text: Crossing my fingers for some Wild ARMS love. Just five more entries!

author: Oznova

text: This iconic track was also featured in another game in 1996 being DKC 3.  I thought it was a nice surprise to see this song in DKC 3.  Anyway, I have loved Mario 64 and it only  took me 16 years to realize the true beauty of this game.  I love everything about and it ranks as my favorite N64 game of all time.  I still think that this soundtrack is one of Kondo's crowning jewels as it one of the 10 best soundtracks I have ever listened to.
author: Eric C.

text: It's amusing. I just needed to read the title and the song started playing in my mind.
author: GabeMorris

text: Magical moments and a game that is just as fun and playable today as it was in 1996; a crown jewel among video games. Greets from Finland!
author: Harri Virtanen

text: This is probably my favorite track in Super Mario 64. It is such a nostalgic track.
author: MegaZeroX7

text: This is the single game that had the biggest impact on my gaming years. I have never been more hyped for a game than Super Mario 64. I'd look at screenshots in magazines and dream of being able to play the game someday. When my parents brought home a brand new N64 with this game, I pretty much had the same reaction as the N64 kid. Controlling Mario for the first time outside the castle is something I'll never forget, it was magical. And I know it was for a lot of you as well.
author: SupraDarky
